caption_original:
Sustainability: we’re listening for your input
We’re hoping to start a conversation... One that results in a solid plan to shape an economically robust and environmentally healthy Canada. Check out our new draft Federal Sustainable Development Strategy, a plan that sets out federal environmental priorities and actions for the next three years. caption_original:
The Environment and Climate Change Canada team is continuing its inventory of waterfowl in the boreal forest. Climb aboard and get a bird’s-eye view of waterfowl species!

Over the coming weeks, the team will visit the following regions: Chibougamau, Parent, Lac Lac-Saint-Jean, Chutes-des-Passes, Baie-Comeau, Sept-Îles, Havre-Saint-Pierre, Natashquan, Manic-Cinq and Parc des Laurentides.

caption_original:
Did you know that healthy salmon populations indicate the health of both our rivers and oceans? That is why Fundy National Park has monitored Inner Bay of Fundy Salmon populations for over 25 years as part of the National iBoF Salmon Recovery program. Together with its partners, Parks Canada is trying to understand what is contributing to the salmon’s demise and what needs to be done to save them. Learn more: http://ow.ly/yw7d300mR0H World Fish Migration Day 
@WorldFishMigrationDay
caption_cleaned: Did you know that healthy salmon populations indicate the health of both our rivers and oceans? That is why Fundy National Park has monitored Inner Bay of Fundy Salmon populations for over years as part of the National iBoF Salmon Recovery program. Together with its partners, Parks Canada is trying to understand what is contributing to the salmon’s demise and what needs to be done to save them. Learn more: World Fish Migration Day

Water is a precious resource that is essential to life, and we all need to do our part to conserve it. 

Canada’s sustainability indicators show that since 2005, power generation and manufacturing sectors have actually consumed less water. You can help too! Taking shorter showers and using rainwater to water plants are just two ways we can conserve this resource. How much less? http://ow.ly/5EK030071FK

caption_original: Today is International Day of Biological Diversity. Why is biodiversity so important? Simple! We all want to continue living in a country where we can watch birds, go fishing, walk in nature, swim in lakes and rivers, and do activities that let us enjoy fresh air and clean water. The diversity of life is essential for us to enjoy these simple pleasures. What can you do to make a difference? http://ow.ly/6sZy300mMdY

caption_original:
Canada’s forests play an essential role in sustaining the quantity and quality of our water supply. They reduce soil erosion, regulate groundwater levels and naturally filter out pollutants.

Environment and Climate Change Canada is proud to work with the Nature Conservancy of Canada to expand the preservation of forested lands around Saint-Hippolyte, Quebec. This initiative will help protect the area’s groundwater resources, as well as conserve the habitat of several species at risk in the area, including the butternut and the pickerel frog. http://ow.ly/4HUf300aLS1
caption_cleaned: Canada’s forests play an essential role in sustaining the quantity and quality of our water supply. They reduce soil erosion, regulate groundwater levels and naturally filter out pollutants. Environment and Climate Change Canada is proud to work with the Nature Conservancy of Canada to eand the preservation of forested lands around Saint-Hippolyte, Quebec. This initiative will help protect the area’s groundwater resources, as well as conserve the habitat of several species at risk in the area, including the butternut and the pickerel frog. 1

caption_original: Do you own a pet amphibian? Have you heard of the Salamander Chytrid Disease (aka Bsal)? Don’t forget to neutralize your cage wastewater before disposing of it. http://ow.ly/4nmPRA
caption_cleaned: Do you own a pet amphibian? Have you heard of the Salamander Chytrid Disease (aka Bsal)? Don’t forget to neutralize your cage wastewater before disposing of it.
